column5: This course is intended to help students learn to think in the manner necessary to fully grasp the nature and power of the digital world around us. The early era of the Internet and the personal computer led to the need for "computer literacy." Now, the changing nature of our global society requires that students learn new ways to think about problems and how to solve them, regardless of students' specific fields of endeavor. Through this course, students will explore major issues related to the "big ideas" of computational thinking (namely, (i) Creativity, (ii) Abstraction, (iii) Data, (iv) Algorithms, (v) Programming, (vi) Internet, and (vii) Societal Impact), as well as how these issues will impact their future lives.Fulfills Mason Core requirement in information technology (all).

column4: offer broad overview comput scienc design provid student introduct field comput scienc orient comput scienc depart comput environ univers includ project introduc problem solv comput corequisit note comput scienc major requir year
column5: Offers a broad overview of computer science designed to provide students with an introduction to the field of computer science and an orientation to the Computer Science department and the computing environment at the university. Includes a project to introduce problem solving using computers. Corequisite(s): CS 112.Notes: All computer science majors are required to take this course within their first year.

column4: intens introduct legal social ethic issu surround softwar develop comput stress profession conduct social respons rigor standard softwar test reliabl examin issu liabil ownership inform comput crime fulfil mason core requir inform technolog ethic
column5: Intensive introduction to legal, social, and ethical issues surrounding software development and computer use. Stresses professional conduct, social responsibility, and rigorous standards for software testing and reliability. Examines issues such as liability, ownership of information, and computer crime.Fulfills Mason Core requirement in  information technology (ethics only).

column4: rigor introduct problem solv develop comput program focus identifi algorithm pattern problem describ problem solut high level pseudocod implement procedur program languag basic program concept cover detail includ express control structur simpl data type input output program test debug discuss verifi problem solv correctli fulfil mason core requir inform technolog ethic
column5: Rigorous introduction to problem solving through development of computer programs. Focuses on identifying algorithmic patterns in problems, describing problem solutions in high-level pseudocode, then implementing in a procedural programming language. Basic programming concepts are covered in detail including expressions, control structures, simple data types, and input/output. Program testing and debugging are discussed to verify that problems are solved correctly.Fulfills Mason Core requirement in information technology (all except ethics).

column3: Computing: From the Abacus to the Web
column4: discuss underli comput scienc concept exist emerg technolog mail internet search engin blog comput game robot histor social technic issu relat topic discuss note student credit successfulli complet intend nonmajor
column5: Discusses the underlying computer science concepts behind existing and emerging technologies (such as e-mail, the Internet, search engines, blogs, computer games, and robotics). Historical, social, and technical issues related to each topic will be discussed. Notes: Students may not take this course for credit once they have successfully completed CS 211. Intended for nonmajors.

column4: treatment program object orient principl introduc class interfac inherit polymorph singl dispatch mean decompos problem cover intermedi program techniqu includ error handl except arrang sourc code packag simpl data structur intermedi debug techniqu unit test cover
column5: Thorough treatment of programming according to object-oriented principles. Introduces classes, interfaces, inheritance, polymorphism, and single dispatch as means to decompose problems. Covers intermediate programming techniques including error handling through exceptions, arrangement of source code into packages, and simple data structures. Intermediate debugging techniques and unit testing are covered.

column4: introduc object orient program elementari data structur emphasi problem languag featur relev engin
column5: Introduces object-oriented programming and elementary data structures. Emphasis on problems and language features relevant to engineers.

column4: explor theori histori cultur lore game emphasi varieti comput game environ
column5: Explores the theory, history, culture, and lore of games with particular emphasis on the varieties of computer game environments.

column4: advanc program java program languag languag offer time
column5: Advanced programming using Java programming language. Other languages may be offered at times.

column4: introduct languag oper system concept unix prepar student topic system program
column5: Introduction to the language C, as well as operating system concepts, in UNIX, to prepare students for topics in systems programming.

column3: Synthesis of Ethics and Law for the Computing Professional
column4: practic effect comput profession examin legal ethic issu surround comput technolog foundat build deal challeng appli philosoph base ethic decis make modern concern rais comput technolog address topic cover intens manner focus emerg legal ethic issu involv commerc widespread internet fulfil mason core requir synthesi fulfil write intens requir major
column5: Practical course to become effective computer professional. Examines legal and ethical issues surrounding computer technology and its use, as well as the foundation building that is necessary to deal with those challenges. Applies philosophical bases for ethical decision making to modern concerns raised by computers and technology. Addresses topics covered by CS 105 in a more intensive manner and focuses on the emerging legal and ethical issues involved in e-commerce and widespread use of the Internet.Fulfills Mason Core requirement in synthesis.Fulfills writing intensive requirement in the major.

column4: focus object orient program emphasi tool techniqu develop moder larg program topic includ implement linear nonlinear data structur design analysi elementari algorithm
column5: Focuses on object-oriented programming with an emphasis on tools and techniques for developing moderate to large programs. Topics include use and implementation of linear and nonlinear data structures and the design and analysis of elementary algorithms.

column4: introduct concept method tool creation larg scale softwar system method tool notat valid techniqu analyz prototyp maintain softwar requir introduct object orient requir model includ case model static model dynam model unifi model languag uml notat concept method design larg scale softwar system fundament design concept design notat introduc studi object orient analysi design model uml notat student particip group project softwar requir specif object orient softwar design fulfil write intens requir major equival swe catalog
column5: An introduction to concepts, methods, and tools for the creation of large-scale software systems. Methods, tools, notations, and validation techniques to analyze, specify, prototype, and maintain software requirements. Introduction to object-oriented requirements modeling, including use of case modeling, static modeling, and dynamic modeling using the Unified Modeling Language (UML) notation. Concepts and methods for the design of large-scale software systems. Fundamental design concepts and design notations are introduced. A study of object-oriented analysis and design modeling using the UML notation. Students participate in a group project on software requirements, specification, and object-oriented software design.Fulfills writing intensive requirement in the major.Equivalent to SWE 321 (2011-2012 Catalog).

column4: game design electron entertain technolog involv divers set skill background narr art comput program survei technic aspect field emphasi program
column5: Game design, in various electronic entertainment technologies, involves a diverse set of skills and backgrounds from narrative and art to computer programming. Surveys the technical aspects of the field, with an emphasis on programming.

column4: abstract concept underli advanc work comput scienc major emphasi formal languag model comput logic proof strategi
column5: Abstract concepts that underlie much advanced work in computer science, with major emphasis on formal languages, models of computation, logic, and proof strategies.

column4: depth studi softwar design implement modern object orient languag support graphic user interfac complex data structur topic cover specif design pattern abstract techniqu includ type access control inherit polymorph student learn proper engin techniqu inform hide class object inherit except handl event base system concurr equival swe
column5: In-depth study of software design and implementation using a modern, object-oriented language with support for graphical user interfaces and complex data structures. Topics covered will be specifications; design patterns; and abstraction techniques; including typing, access control, inheritance, and polymorphism. Students will learn the proper engineering use of techniques such as information hiding, classes, objects, inheritance, exception handling, event-based systems, and concurrency.Equivalent to SWE 332

column4: focus program essenti mathemat geometr concept underli comput graphic cover fundament topic comput geometri model graphic algorithm graphic user interfac implement reinforc object orient program practic
column5: Focuses on programming essential mathematical and geometric concepts underlying computer graphics. Covers fundamental topics in computational geometry, 3D modeling, graphics algorithms, and graphical user interfaces using both 2D and 3D implementations. Reinforces object-oriented programming practices.

column4: introduc student comput system programm perspect topic includ data represent assembl machin level represent high level languag program memori hierarchi link except interrupt process signal virtual memori system level foundat cours compil network oper system comput architectur deeper understand system level issu requir
column5: Introduces students to computer systems from a programmer's perspective. Topics include data representation, assembly and machine-level representation of high-level language programs, the memory hierarchy, linking, exceptions, interrupts, processes and signals, virtual memory, and system-level I/O. Foundation for courses on compilers; networks; operating systems; and computer architecture, where a deeper understanding of systems-level issues is required.

column3: Research and Project Design Principles in Computing
column4: introduc student research project design process comput field student learn tool trade work design principl begin articul question review method explor gather evid commun result assess evalu research project outcom
column5: This course introduces students to the research and project design process within the computing field. Students will learn about the tools of the trade, work through design principles beginning with the articulation of a question, reviewing methods of exploration, gathering evidence, communicating results, and assessing and evaluating research or project outcomes.

column4: program intens lab student refin problem solv program skill gain experi teamwork focus data structur recurs backtrack dynam program debug central focu appli familiar algorithm data structur circumst corequisit grade permiss instructor
column5: Programming-intensive lab course. Students refine problem-solving and programming skills while gaining experience in teamwork. Focuses on data structures, recursion, backtracking, dynamic programming, and debugging. Central focus is applying familiar and new algorithms and data structures to novel circumstances. Corequisite(s): Grade of C or better in CS 310 and permission of instructor.

column4: introduct technolog techniqu modern comput game team explor facet complet design sophist tool includ project game prototyp prototyp initi design serv start point project
column5: Introduction to technologies and techniques used in modern computer games. Teams will explore the various facets of a complete design using sophisticated tools. Includes a project in which a game is prototyped; this prototype and initial design will serve as the starting point for the project in CS 426.

column4: project orient continu emphasi implement complet game
column5: Project-orientated continuation of CS 425 with an emphasis on the implementation of a complete game.

column4: survei basic program languag processor softwar develop tool assembl interpret compil topic includ design construct languag processor formal syntact definit method pars techniqu code gener techniqu
column5: Survey of basic programming language processors and software development tools such as assemblers, interpreters, and compilers. Topics include design and construction of language processors, formal syntactic definition methods, parsing techniques, and code-generation techniques.

column4: introduc comput method molecular biologi cover broad arrai topic bioinformat comput biologi organ week modul intend captur current classif bioinformat comput biologi method provid student broad view field
column5: Introduces computational methods in molecular biology. Covers a broad array of topics in bioinformatics and computational biology.Œæ Organized as 3 four-week modules intended to capture the current classification of bioinformatics and computational biology methods, thereby providing students with a broad view of the field.

column4: fundament principl techniqu implement comput algorithm solv problem biologi aris process larg volum genom inform topic includ sequenc analysi align assembl gene predict knowledg base protein structur predict project involv design program basic align predict method
column5: Fundamental principles and techniques for implementing computational algorithms to solve problems in biology arising from the need to process large volumes of genomic information. Topics include sequence analysis, alignment, and assembly, gene prediction, and knowledge-based protein structure prediction. Projects involve designing and programming basic alignment and prediction methods.

column4: cover basic intermedi knowledg design implement relat databas system topic includ entiti relationship entiti enhanc relationship eer model databas design relat algebra structur queri languag sql sql program techniqu function depend normal object object relat databas secur student practic design develop implement relat oracl databas databas queri transact process report gener
column5: Covers basics to intermediate knowledge for the design, implementation, and use of relational database systems. Topics include the Entity-Relationship (ER) and Entity-Enhanced Relationship (EER) models for database design, Relational Algebra (RA), Structured Query Language (SQL), SQL programming techniques, functional dependencies and normalization, object and object-relational databases, and security. Students will practice to design, develop, and implement a relational ORACLE database and use the database for queries, transaction processing, and report generation.

column4: basic graphic principl program topic includ scan convers transform view light blend textur map advanc graphic techniqu
column5: Basic graphics principles and programming. Topics include scan conversion, transformation, viewing, lighting, blending, texture mapping, and some advanced graphics techniques.

column4: data commun network protocol studi organ follow layer internet protocol suit tcp famili protocol topic includ role media softwar compon local wide area network protocol network perform emerg advanc commerci technolog
column5: Data communications and networking protocols, with study organized to follow layers of Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP family of protocols). Topics include role of various media and software components, local and wide area network protocols, network performance, and emerging advanced commercial technologies.

column4: kei program mechan independ machin languag includ control bind procedur abstract type concurr includ basic program compet type program languag includ languag concurr equival catalog
column5: Key programming mechanisms described independently of particular machines or languages, including control, binding, procedural abstraction, types, and concurrency. Includes basic programming competence in several different types of programming languages, including a language that provides concurrency.Equivalent to CS 363 (2013-2014 Catalog).

column4: comput subsystem instruct set architectur singl cycl multipl cycl pipelin architectur memori hierarchi cach virtual memori input output process
column5: Computer subsystems and instruction set architectures. Single-cycle, multiple-cycle, and pipeline architectures. Memory hierarchy, cache, and virtual memory input-output processing.

column4: fundament principl techniqu implement secur comput system topic includ secur cryptographi basic vulner analysi secur softwar develop distribut system secur project involv design program basic secur tool secur program distribut system
column5: Fundamental principles and techniques for implementing secure computer systems. Topics include security and cryptography basics, vulnerability analysis, secure software development, and distributed system security. Projects involve designing and programming basic security tools, secure programs, and distributed systems.

column4: cover softwar subsystem involv defend comput system studi threat architect solut includ limit access control ident manag network system secur intrus detect recoveri system monitor forens system
column5: Covers the software subsystems that are involved in defending computer systems. Studies threats and architecting solutions against them, including but not limited to access control and identity management, network and system security, intrusion detection and recovery systems, monitoring and forensic systems.

column4: issu multiprogram cover concurr process synchron mechan processor schedul memori file deadlock manag perform oper system project deal synchron multiprogram virtual memori manag
column5: Issues in multiprogramming. Covers concurrent processes and synchronization mechanisms; processor scheduling; memory, file, I/O, and deadlock management; performance of operating systems; and projects dealing with synchronization in multiprogrammed OS and virtual memory management.

column4: practic issu design implement concurr distribut softwar topic includ concurr program synchron multithread local wide area network protocol distribut comput system integr techniqu express coarsegrain parallel applic level project involv network program applic level
column5: Practical issues in designing and implementing concurrent and distributed software. Topics include concurrent programming, synchronization, multithreading, local and wide-area network protocols, distributed computation, systems integration, and techniques for expressing coarsegrained parallelism at the application level. Projects involve network programming at application level.

column4: project base teach fundament principl softwar develop mobil devic environ emphas applic numer academ concept design program paradigm stem mobil devic topic includ user interfac event base program interprocess commun network mobil specif capabl perform resourc restrict environ
column5: This project based course will teach fundamental principles of software development for the mobile device environment, emphasizing the application of numerous academic concepts and the new design and programming paradigms that stem from the use of mobile devices. Topics include user interfaces, event-based programming, interprocess communications, networking, mobile-specific capabilities and performance in a resource restricted environment.

column4: principl method knowledg represent reason learn problem solv plan heurist search natur languag process applic build intellig system varieti domain lisp prolog expert system program languag
column5: Principles and methods for knowledge representation, reasoning, learning, problem solving, planning, heuristic search, and natural language processing and their application to building intelligent systems in a variety of domains. Uses LISP, PROLOG, or expert system programming language.

column4: basic principl visual percept implement comput system topic includ earli visual process edg detect segment intrins imag imag model represent visual knowledg imag understand student complet project involv real imag
column5: Basic principles of visual perception and their implementation on computer systems. Topics include early visual processing, edge detection, segmentation, intrinsic images, image modeling, representation of visual knowledge, and image understanding. Students complete projects involving real images.

column4: analyz comput resourc import problem type altern algorithm data structur mathemat rigor techniqu specif algorithm analyz improv
column5: Analyzes computational resources for important problem types by alternative algorithms and their associated data structures, using mathematically rigorous techniques. Specific algorithms analyzed and improved.

column4: basic principl method data analysi knowledg discoveri emphas develop basic skill model predict perform evalu topic includ system design data qualiti preprocess associ event classif cluster biometr busi intellig mine complex type data
column5: Basic principles and methods for data analysis and knowledge discovery. Emphasizes developing basic skills for modeling and prediction and performance evaluation. Topics include system design; data quality, preprocessing, and association; event classification; clustering; biometrics; business intelligence; and mining complex types of data.

column4: cover basic topic autonom robot autonom architectur interact physic hardwar elementari kinemat robot control motion trajectori plan local task plan learn adapt model sensor fusion includ project involv physic robot
column5: Covers various basic topics in autonomous robotics, such as autonomous architectures and their interaction with physical hardware, elementary kinematics and robot control, motion and trajectory planning, localization, task planning, learning and adaptation, modeling, and sensor fusion. Includes projects involving physical robots.

column4: capston focus design success implement major softwar project encompass broad spectrum knowledg skill develop team student requir final exhibit faculti industri panel
column5: Capstone course focusing on design and successful implementation of major software project, encompassing broad spectrum of knowledge and skills, developed by team of students. Requires final exhibition to faculty-industry panel.

column4: research analysi select problem topic comput scienc topic arrang instructor approv depart chair regist
column5: Research and analysis of selected problems or topics in computer science. Topic must be arranged with instructor and approved by department chair before registering.

column3: Principles of Data Management and Mining
column4: techniqu store manag data includ databas relat model schema queri transact line transact process data wareh star schema line analyt process molap holap hybrid system overview data mine principl model supervis unsupervis learn pattern find massiv parallel architectur hadoop
column5: Techniques to store, manage, and use data including databases, relational model, schemas, queries and transactions. On Line Transaction Processing, Data Warehousing, star schema, On Line Analytical Processing. MOLAP, HOLAP, and hybrid systems. Overview of Data Mining principles, models, supervised and unsupervised learning, pattern finding. Massively parallel architectures and Hadoop.

column4: focus topic basic mathemat structur mathemat logic probabl theori applic concept problem solv formal reason hand practic comput tool
column5: This course focuses on the topics of basic mathematical structures, mathematical logic and probability theory; and application of these concepts to problem solving and formal reasoning through hand-on practice with the use of computational tools.

column4: introduc system network program unix window lectur hand lab cover ansi program system librari api fork thread interprocess commun synchron window api code debuggingequival isa catalog
column5: Introduces systems and network programming for UNIX and Windows using lectures and hands-on labs. Covers ANSI C programming, system libraries and APIs, forking and threads, interprocess communications, synchronization, Windows API, and code debuggingEquivalent to ISA 563 (2014-2015 Catalog).

column4: basic program languag processor assembl interpret compil topic includ design construct languag processor formal syntact definit method pars techniqu code gener techniqu lab includ construct languag processor experi program environ
column5: Basic programming language processors such as assemblers, interpreters, and compilers. Topics include design and construction of language processors, formal syntactic definition methods, parsing techniques, and code generation techniques. Lab includes construction of language processors and experience with programming environments.

column4: introduct databas manag focu architect databas applic topic cover includ data model entiti relationship model relat data model formal languag sql theori databas design object databas xml web data
column5: An introduction to database management with focus on architecting databases and using them in applications.Œæ Topics to be covered include: data modeling with the Entity-Relationship model, the relational data model and its formal languages, SQL, the theory of database design, object databases, XML and Web data.

column4: graphic principl program topic includ graphic hardwar antialias transform view illumin blend textur map color model curv surfac anim equival catalog
column5: Graphics principles and programming. Topics include graphics hardware, antialiasing, transformations, viewing, illumination, blending, texture mapping, color models, curves, surfaces, and animation.Equivalent to CS 652 (2011-2012 Catalog)

column4: techniqu system commun data comput devic layer internet protocol suit topic includ role media softwar compon local wide area network protocol network design perform cost consider emerg advanc commerci technolog emphas tcp famili protocol
column5: Techniques and systems for communication of data between computational devices and layers of Internet Protocol Suite. Topics include role of various media and software components, local and wide area network protocols, network design, performance and cost considerations, and emerging advanced commercial technologies. Emphasizes TCP/IP family of protocols.

column4: model oper system major function includ process memori manag interprocess commun file directori shell distribut system perform user interfac
column5: Models of operating systems. Major functions including processes, memory management, I/O, interprocess communication, files, directories, shells, distributed systems, performance, and user interface.

column4: principl method knowledg represent reason learn problem solv plan heurist search natur languag process applic build intellig system varieti domain lisp prolog expert system program languag
column5: Principles and methods for knowledge representation, reasoning, learning, problem solving, planning, heuristic search, and natural language processing and their application to building intelligent systems in a variety of domains. LISP, PROLOG, or expert system programming language.

column4: topic includ analyz sequenti parallel algorithm strategi greedi method divid conquer strategi dynam program search travers techniqu approxim algorithm analyz specif algorithm fall class hard complet problem
column5: Topics include analyzing sequential and parallel algorithmic strategies such as greedy methods, divide and conquer strategies, dynamic programming, search and traversal techniques, and approximation algorithms; and analyzing specific algorithms falling into these classes, NP-Hard and NP-Complete problems.

column3: Theory and Applications of Data Mining
column4: concept techniqu data mine multidisciplinari applic topic includ databas data clean transform concept descript associ correl rule data classif predict model perform analysi scalabl data mine advanc databas system includ text audio imag emerg theme futur challeng equival catalog
column5: Concepts and techniques in data mining and multidisciplinary applications. Topics include databases; data cleaning and transformation; concept description; association and correlation rules; data classification and predictive modeling; performance analysis and scalability; data mining in advanced database systems, including text, audio, and images; and emerging themes and future challenges.Equivalent to CS 659 (2014-2015 Catalog).

column4: introduct logic proof techniqu formal languag automata theori comput complex specif topic includ regular context free languag ture machin complet undecid
column5: Introduction to logic and proof techniques, formal languages, automata theory, and computational complexity. Specific topics include regular and context-free languages, Turing machines, NP-completeness, and undecidability.

column4: cover fundament principl techniqu implement comput algorithm solv problem biologi aris process larg volum genom inform topic includ sequenc analysi align sequenc assembl gene predict protein structur predict
column5: Covers fundamental principles and techniques for implementing computational algorithms to solve problems in biology arising from the need to process large volumes of genomic information. Topics include sequence analysis, alignments, sequence assembly, gene prediction, and protein structure prediction.

column4: overview advanc algorithm design analysi techniqu topic includ algorithm hash tabl matrix oper number theori string match comput geometri combinatori optim linear program area complet approxim algorithm
column5: Provides an overview of advanced algorithm design and analysis techniques. Topics include algorithms for hash tables, matrix operations, number theory, string matching, computational geometry, combinatorial optimization, and linear programming; also the areas of NP-completeness and approximation algorithms.

column4: basic principl method comput field geometr model emphas data structur repres geometr object algorithm manipul data structur topic includ rang search polygon triangul convex hull motion plan visibl mesh gener
column5: Basic principles and methods for computing in field of geometric modeling. Emphasizes data structures used to represent geometric objects and algorithms for manipulating those data structures. Topics include range searching, polygon triangulation, convex hulls, motion-planning, visibility, and mesh generation.

column4: cover major parallel comput paradigm mimd comput simd comput data flow comput emphas interfac algorithm design implement architectur softwar examin parallel algorithm parallel program languag rel architectur parallel comput
column5: Covers three major parallel computing paradigms: MIMD computation, SIMD computation, and data flow computation. Emphasizes interfaces between algorithm design and implementation, architecture, and software. Examines parallel algorithms and parallel programming languages relative to architecture of particular parallel computers.

column4: examin advanc compil techniqu code optim sequenti parallel machin compil logic function object orient languag topic current literatur
column5: Examines advanced compiler techniques such as code optimizations for sequential and parallel machines; compilers for logical, functional, or object-oriented languages; and other topics in current literature.

column4: studi intern architectur databas system topic includ physic data organ index queri process optim transact process databas system architectur web servic web data secur
column5: Study of the internal architecture of database systems.  Topics include: physical data organization and indexing, query processing and optimization, transaction processing, database system architectures, Web services and Web data security.

column4: cover techniqu mine larg dataset includ distribut file system map reduc similar search data stream process cover classic problem data mine cluster associ rule mine point view scalabl includ final project exercis concept cover class equival catalog
column5: Covers the techniques to mine large datasets, including Distributed File Systems and Map-Reduce, similarity search, and data stream processing.Œæ Covers classic problems in data mining, such as clustering, association rule mining, and others from the point of view of scalability.Œæ Includes a final project to exercise concepts covered in class.Equivalent to CS 757 (2014-2015 Catalog).

column4: topic cover lectur network virtual environ overview network technolog network multimedia concept virtual simul concept effici perform issu onlin conferenc virtual classroom project consist segment cover aspect network virtual environ final session person team creat minim function network virtual environ internet overlai multicast softwar consist minut session major java program project present discuss class minut examin lectur record network educationwar format playback flexibl schedul share institut academ calendar
column5: Topics covered in lecture are: networked virtual environment overview, networking technology, network multimedia concepts, virtual simulation concepts, efficiency/performance issues, and online conferencing/virtual classrooms. The project consists of four segments, each covering one aspect of networked virtual environments, plus a final session where one- or two-person teams create a minimally functional networked virtual environment over the Internet using overlay multicast software. The course consists of 31 50-minute sessions plus a major Java programming project which will be presented and discussed in class and two 90-minute examinations. Lectures are recorded in Network EducationWare (NEW) format and are available for playback on a flexible schedule, which is necessary since the course is shared among institutions having different academic calendars.

column4: address graphic game techniqu includ collis detect level detail physic base simul textur map shadow
column5: Addresses some graphics game techniques including collision detection, levels of detail, physics-based simulations, textures, maps, and shadows.

column4: basic principl method automat authent individu technolog includ face fingerprint iri recognit speaker verif addit topic cover multimod biometr system design perform evalu privaci concern term project requir
column5: Basic principles and methods for automatic authentication of individuals. Technologies include face, fingerprint, and iris recognition; and speaker verification. Additional topics cover multimodal biometrics, system design, performance evaluation, and privacy concerns. Term project required.

column4: theori practic analyt model comput system topic includ open close multiclass queu network singl multipl class analysi markov chain perform avail model internet data center softwar perform engin commerc perform
column5: Theory and practice of analytical models of computer systems. Topics include open and closed multiclass queuing networks, single and multiple class Mean Value Analysis, Markov Chains, performance and availability models of Internet data centers, software performance engineering, and e-commerce performance.

column4: focus technolog develop environ develop multimedia applic project involv experi multimedia author tool simul assess perform
column5: Focuses on technological and development environments in developing multimedia applications. Projects involve experience with multimedia authoring tools and simulations to assess performance.

column4: cover advanc techniqu manag search mine type data text web link imag time seri video audio issu relat handl data discuss includ featur select high dimension index interact search inform retriev pattern discoveri scalabl equival catalog
column5: Covers advanced techniques for managing, searching, and mining of various types of data such as text, web links, images, time series, video, and audio. Issues related to handling such data will be discussed, including feature selection, high dimensional indexing, interactive search and information retrieval, pattern discovery, and scalability.Equivalent to CS 780 (2014-2015 Catalog).

column4: issu design implement distribut system applic topic includ distribut commun paradigm middlewar coordin synchron distribut transact consist replic fault toler reliabl peer peer system
column5: Issues in design and implementation of distributed systems and applications. Topics include distributed communication paradigms, middleware, coordination and synchronization, distributed transactions, consistency and replication, fault-tolerance and reliability, and peer-to-peer systems.

column4: design construct evalu softwar system solv problem gener deem requir human expertis focus studi relev languag environ mathemat logic case studi success system program project includ develop tool small scale system
column5: Design, construction, and evaluation of software systems that solve problems generally deemed to require human expertise. Focuses on study and use of relevant languages, environments, mathematics, and logic. Case studies of successful systems. Programming projects include development of tools or small-scale systems.

column4: studi comput model visual percept implement comput system topic includ earli visual process edg detect segment intrins imag imag model represent visual knowledg imag understand
column5: Study of computational models of visual perception and their implementation in computer systems. Topics include early visual processing, edge detection, segmentation, intrinsic images, image modeling, representation of visual knowledge, and image understanding.

column4: examin design analysi parallel algorithm materi focus algorithm theoret practic model parallel comput consid algorithm design analysi pram exist simd mimd type architectur topic includ sort graph algorithm numer algorithm comput complex
column5: Examines design and analysis of parallel algorithms. Material focuses on algorithms for both theoretical and practical models of parallel computation. Considers algorithm design and analysis for PRAM and existing SIMD and MIMD type architectures. Topics include sorting, graph algorithms, numerical algorithms, and computational complexity.

column4: data structur analyt techniqu studi graph algorithm data structur includ disjoint set heap dynam tree algorithm includ minimum span tree shortest path maximum flow graph planar
column5: Data structures and analytical techniques to study graph algorithms. Data structures include disjoint sets, heaps, and dynamic trees. Algorithms include minimum spanning trees, shortest path, maximum flow, and graph planarity.

column4: review develop intellig autonom system studi applic artifici intellig comput vision machin learn robot topic includ analysi design algorithm architectur plan navig sensori data understand sensor fusion spatial reason motion control knowledg acquisit learn concept procedur organ adapt environ
column5: Reviews developments in intelligent autonomous systems. Studies applications of artificial intelligence, computer vision, and machine learning to robotics. Topics include analysis and design of algorithms and architectures for planning, navigation, sensory data understanding, sensor fusion, spatial reasoning, motion control, knowledge acquisition, learning concepts and procedures, self-organization, and adaptation to environment.

column4: concept techniqu imag process discuss method imag captur transform enhanc restor encod student complet project involv natur occur imag
column5: Concepts and techniques in image processing. Discusses methods for image capture, transformation, enhancement, restoration, and encoding. Students complete projects involving naturally occurring images.

column4: explor foundat issu artifici intellig role knowledg search formal knowledg infer symbol versu emerg approach intellig studi advanc program techniqu artifici intellig relationship foundat issu import applic area artifici intellig
column5: Explores foundational issues of artificial intelligence, such as roles of knowledge and search, formalization of knowledge and inference, and symbolic versus emergent approaches to intelligence. Studies advanced programming techniques for artificial intelligence, relationship to foundational issues, and important application areas for artificial intelligence.

column4: explor statist pattern recognit neural network pattern recognit topic includ bayesian classif decis theori densiti parametr nonparametr estim linear nonlinear discrimin analysi dimension reduct featur extract select mixtur model vector quantiz cluster neural network topic includ feed forward network back propag organ featur map radial basi function emphas experiment design applic perform evalu
column5: Explores statistical pattern recognition and neural networks. Pattern recognition topics include Bayesian classification and decision theory, density (parametric and nonparametric) estimation, linear and nonlinear discriminant analysis, dimensionality reduction, feature extraction and selection, mixture models and EM, and vector quantization and clustering. Neural networks topics include feed-forward networks and back-propagation, self-organization feature maps, and radial basis functions. Emphasizes experimental design, applications, and performance evaluation.

column3: Planning Motions of Robots and Molecules
column4: cover topic artifici intellig algorithm databas present algorithm model simul physic biolog system focus motion plan algorithm robot system presenc obstacl simpl determinist sampl base approach motion plan cover advanc plan method includ plan kinemat dynam constraint select topic includ sensor base motion plan manipul plan assembl plan plan uncertainti robot inspir method comput function relev motion molecular chain
column5: Covers topics from artificial intelligence, algorithms and databases. Presents algorithms that model and simulate physical and biological systems and focuses on motion-planning algorithms for robotic systems in the presence of obstacles. Simple deterministic and sampling-based approaches to motion planning will be covered, as well as advanced planning methods including planning with kinematics and dynamic constraints. Selected topics include sensor-based motion planning, manipulation planning, assembly planning, planning under uncertainty and robotics-inspired methods to compute functionally-relevant motions of molecular chains.

column4: special topic comput scienc occur regular comput scienc sequenc
column5: Special topics in computer science not occurring in regular computer science sequence.

column4: student undertak studi supervis consent faculti member student submit written statement content tent read list part request approv literatur review project report written product requir
column5: Students may undertake a course of study under supervision of consenting faculty member. Students usually submit written statement of course content and tentative reading list as part of request for approval. Literature review, project report, or other written product usually required.

column3: Quantitative Methods and Experimental Design in Computer Science
column4: integr treatment model practic experiment comput scienc topic includ scientif method appli comput workload character forecast perform qualiti metric system analyt simul model design experi interpret present experiment result hypothesi test statist analys data involv larg scale project
column5: Integrated treatment of models and practices in experimental computer science. Topics include scientific methods applied to computing, workload characterization, forecasting of performance and quality metrics of systems, uses of analytic and simulation models, design of experiments, interpretation and presentation of experimental results, hypothesis testing, and statistical analyses of data. Involves one or more large-scale projects.

column4: topic includ concurr program languag construct specif design verif valid concurr program student requir solv concurr program problem check solut verif test debug tool
column5: Topics include concurrent programming languages and constructs, and specification, design, verification, and validation of concurrent programs. Students required to solve concurrent programming problems and check solutions by using verification, testing, and debugging tools.

column4: discuss quantit point view characterist import technolog support implement busi site includ topic hardwar softwar architectur busi site authent payment servic understand custom behavior workload character scalabl analysi perform predict
column5: Discusses, from quantitative point of view, characteristics of most important technologies used to support implementation of e-business sites. Includes topics such as hardware and software architectures of e-business sites, authentication, payment services, understanding customer behavior, workload characterization, scalability analysis, and performance prediction.

column4: advanc graphic method tool topic includ visual model render anim simul virtual realiti graphic softwar tool current research topic
column5: Advanced graphics methods and tools. Topics include visualization, modeling, rendering, animation, simulation, virtual reality, graphics software tools, and current research topics.

column4: current emerg issu advanc comput network applic topic includ softwar system packet cell switch network architectur protocol high perform lan schedul congest control mobil network multimedia applic gener internet
column5: Current and emerging issues in advanced computer networks and applications. Topics include software systems associated with packet and cell-switched networking architectures and protocols, high-performance LANs, scheduling and congestion control, mobile networking, multimedia applications, and next generation of Internet.

column4: analyt simul techniqu model analyz comput network examin elementari queu analysi network queue rout flow control applic local wide area network internet emerg network technolog
column5: Analytical and simulation techniques for modeling and analyzing computer networks. Examines elementary queuing analysis; networks of queues; routing and flow controls; and applications to local and wide area networks, Internet, and emerging networking technologies.

column4: real time system principl support design implement emphas fundament result real time schedul theori relev comput system design topic includ system design issu real time applic involv oper system commun network databas multimedia
column5: Real-time systems and principles supporting design and implementation. Emphasizes fundamental results from real-time scheduling theory and relevance to computer system design. Topics include system design issues for real-time applications involving operating systems, communication networks, databases, and multimedia

column4: studi recent advanc develop machin vision algorithm knowledg base vision system topic includ scalespac gabor wavelet process distribut hierarch process neural network motion analysi activ function select percept object target recognit expert system data fusion machin learn emphas system integr term percept control action adapt present applic robot intellig highwai inspect forens data compress
column5: Studies recent advances in development of machine vision algorithms and knowledge-based vision systems. Topics include scalespace; Gabor and wavelet processing; distributed and hierarchical processing using neural networks; motion analysis; active, functional, and selective perception; object and target recognition; expert systems; data fusion; and machine learning. Emphasizes system integration in terms of perception, control, action, and adaptation. Presents applications to robotics, intelligent highways, inspection, forensic, and data compression.

column4: cover statist pattern recognit neural network statist learn theori approach topic includ decis theori bay theorem densiti parametr nonparametr estim linear nonlinear discrimin analysi svm kernel method srm model select perform evalu mixtur expert adaboost dimension reduct featur select extract cluster emphas experiment design applic perform evalu
column5: Covers statistical pattern recognition, neural network, and statistical learning theory approaches. Topics include decision theory and Bayes' theorem, density (parametric and nonparametric) estimation, linear and nonlinear discriminant analysis, SVM and kernel methods, SRM and model selection, performance evaluation, mixture of experts (AdaBoost), dimensionality reduction, feature selection and extraction, and clustering. Emphasizes experimental design, applications, and performance evaluation.

column4: current emerg issu human comput intellig interact human center system applic topic includ video process visual virtual environ adapt tutor imag scene model analysi synthesi face gestur recognit speech natur languag process
column5: Current and emerging issues in human-computer intelligent interaction, and human-centered systems and their applications. Topics include video processing, visualization, virtual environments, adaptation and tutoring, image and scene modeling, analysis and synthesis, face and gesture recognition, and speech and natural language processing.

column3: Topics in Resilient and Secure Computer Systems
column4: cover studi altern comput secur includ method combin layer defens factor affect select architectur review recent paper report
column5: Covers study of alternate computer security, including how these methods can be combined in a layered defense and factors that affect the selection of the architectures. Reviews recent papers and reports.

column4: survei machin learn develop intellig adapt system improv learn input data problem solv experi topic provid broad coverag develop machin learn includ basic learn strategi multistrategi learn
column5: Surveys machine learning concerning development of intelligent adaptive systems that are able to improve through learning from input data or from their own problem-solving experience. Topics provide broad coverage of developments in machine learning, including basic learning strategies and multistrategy learning.

column4: decis guidanc system support iter process give action recommend extract feedback human decis maker goal arriv action focus model languag algorithm applic decis guidanc manag system fast develop decis guidanc applic
column5: Decision-guidance systems support an iterative process of giving actionable recommendations to and extracting feedbacks from human decision-makers, with the goal of arriving at the best possible course of action. Focuses on models, languages, algorithms and applications of Decision-Guidance Management Systems, used for fast development of decision-guidance applications.

column4: studi manag optim configur tune heal protect comput system analyz exampl autonom system techniqu design build system doctor seminar base read analysi current paper
column5: Studies self-managing, self-optimizing, self-configuring, self-tuning, self-healing, and self-protecting computing systems. This course analyzes many examples of autonomic systems as well as various techniques to design and build such systems. This is a doctoral seminar based on reading and analysis of current papers.

column4: advanc topic occur regular sequenc
column5: Advanced topics not occurring in regular sequence.

column4: master degre candid undertak project knowledg gain program
column5: Master's degree candidates undertake a project using knowledge gained in MS program.

column4: origin expositori work evalu committe faculti member
column5: Original or expository work evaluated by committee of three faculty members.

column4: student requir attend colloquia includ talk distinguish speaker faculti candid mason faculti
column5: Students are required to attend colloquia including talks by distinguished speakers, faculty candidates, and Mason faculty.

column3: Research Topics in Machine Learning and Inference
column4: present unifi principl underli divers method paradigm approach machin earn infer review learn infer system discuss strength limit suggest area applic hand experi experi state art learn infer system work project tailor research interest
column5: Presents unifying principles that underlie diverse methods, paradigms, and approaches to machine earning and inference. Reviews most known learning and inference systems, discusses strengths and limitations, and suggests most appropriate areas of application. Hands-on experience by experimenting with state-of-the-art learning and inference systems and working on projects tailored to research interests.

column4: discuss current research topic comput system topic vari faculti interest topic includ peer peer comput high perform distribut comput sensor hoc network autonom comput virtual web servic middlewar
column5: Discussion of current research topics in computer systems. Topics vary according to faculty interest. Possible topics include peer-to-peer computing, high-performance distributed computing, sensor and ad hoc networks, autonomic computing, virtualization, and web services and middleware.

column4: special topic artifici intellig occur regular comput scienc sequenc note requir substanti student particip subject matter includ continu exist level cours artifici intellig topic repeat credit subject matter differ
column5: Special topics in artificial intelligence not occurring in regular computer science sequence. Notes: Requires substantial student participation. Subject matter may include continuation of existing 600- or 700-level courses in artificial intelligence or other topics. May be repeated for credit when subject matter differs.

column3: Advanced Topics in Computer Vision and Robotics
column4: cover recent develop topic motiv applic autonom robot system mobil robot navig multirobot system human comput environ interact imag video search analysi content discoveri visual surveil topic includ structur motion recoveri motion understand map build local object detect recognit target track project experiment evalu emphas
column5: Covers recent developments. Topics motivated by applications to autonomous robotic systems, mobile robot navigation, multirobot systems, human-computer-environment interaction, image/video search and analysis, content discovery, and visual surveillance. Topics include 3D structure and motion recovery, motion understanding, map building and localization, object detection and recognition, and target tracking. Projects and experimental evaluation emphasized.

column4: advanc topic occur regular sequenc
column5: Advanced topics not occurring in regular sequence.

column5: Reading and research on a specific topic under the direction of a faculty member.

column5: Students put together a professional presentation of a research proposal and present it for critique to fellow students and interested faculty.Equivalent to IT 990, STAT 990.

column5: Work on a research proposal that forms the basis for a doctoral dissertation.
